text.text_translated:
Pi's religion is important to him.
His family is Hindu.
But Pi wants to know about other religions.
He makes friends with a Christian church leader.
He also makes friends with a Muslim person who makes bread.

Everyone was surprised.
Pi said he was Hindu, Muslim, and Christian.
His family and teachers asked him to choose one religion.
Pi said no.
He said, "I just want to love God."

After that, his family and teachers let him decide.
They let him choose his own religion.

best_attempt.text_translated:
Pi thinks religion is important. His family is Hindu. But he wants to know about other religions. He makes friends with a Christian church leader. He also makes friends with a Muslim person who makes bread.

Everyone was surprised. Pi said he was Hindu, Muslim, and Christian. He said he was all three at the same time. His family and teachers asked him to choose one religion. Pi said no. He said, "I just want to love God."

After that, his family and teachers let him decide. They let him choose his own religion.
